video.title: How to Install Python on Windows and Run Your First Script

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: In this guide, you’ll learn how to install Python on a Windows computer and run your first Python script. This tutorial is designed for beginners and covers everything you need to get started.

sections.title: Downloading and Installing Python
sections.content: Visit the official Python website and download the latest stable version of Python for Windows. During installation, make sure to check the option to add Python to your system PATH so it can be run from the terminal.

sections.title: Installing Visual Studio Code
sections.content: Visual Studio Code (VS Code) is a popular and lightweight code editor. Download it from the official website and follow the installation steps. Once installed, it will be used to write and manage your Python scripts.

sections.title: Creating Your First Python File
sections.content: Open Visual Studio Code and create a new file. Save the file with a .py extension, for example: hello.py. This tells the system that the file contains Python code.

sections.title: Writing a Simple Python Script
sections.content: Start with a simple script to verify that everything is working correctly.

sections.title: Running a Python Script from the Terminal
sections.content: Open the terminal in Visual Studio Code or use the Windows Command Prompt. Navigate to the folder where your .py file is saved and run the script using the python command.

sections.title: Understanding the Output
sections.content: If Python is installed correctly, you should see the text output printed in the terminal. If you encounter errors, double-check that Python was added to PATH and that the file name is correct.

sections.title: Working with Variables
sections.content: Once your setup is complete, you can start experimenting with basic Python concepts like variables.

sections.title: Running Updated Scripts
sections.content: Whenever you modify your Python script, save the file and run it again in the terminal. This feedback loop is how you learn and debug your code.

sections.title: Summary and Next Steps
sections.content: You’ve successfully installed Python, set up Visual Studio Code, and run your first scripts. From here, you can move on to learning variables, data types, and control structures to start building real programs.
